text: KØLF 240217. Black color with a tan head. Aroma is licorice, roasted malt. Flavor is licorice, roasted malt, coffee, dried fruits, vanilla, dark chocolate. Full body. Smooth, pleasant and a very nice beer.

Bottle. Dark brown pour with a chocolate head. Intriguing dark roasted malt bouquet. Dark roasted malts, anise, bakers chocolate highlights. Hint of tobacco. Good body and mouthfeel. Bitter but from the toasted malts as opposed to hops.

W aromacie kawa, ciasteczka zbożowe i gorzka czekolada, po ogrzaniu wanilia. W smaku na początku solidnie kwaskowaty, trochę taka kwaśna kawa, po chwili do gry wchodzi jednak solidna paloność by na koniec ustąpić kawie, ale już w dużo lepszym niekwaśnym wydaniu. Lekko popiołowe, wytrawne taki jak FES być powinien, smaczne.

Aroma: malta tostada, café. Aspecto: negro de tono, cabeza cremosa gruesa del marrón, desapareciendo bastante rápidamente. Sabor: inicialmente dulce y luego un poco mordedor. Boca: cremosa, baja carbonatación, los amargos continúan. En general: impresionante Foreign Stout.

33 cl bottle served in pint glass at La Linterna Ciega, Seville. Pours slowly (so dense) bright jet black with thick, dense, long-lasting, moccha-coloured head. Heavy aromas of espresso coffee. Also bacon, oak coals, black olive. Mouthfeel is dense, oily, velvety. Powerful and balanced. Very bitter long-lasting finish, with more coffee and milky scents. Great one.
Black of color with a beige head. An aroma of chalk, roasted malt and coffee. Af flavor of roasted malt, coffee, chalk, dry and malt.
Bottle from Lagerlager - pitch black motor oil color, beige head. taste is pumpernickel, bread, dark malts, dark chocolate, dry medium bitter finish. good stout, but I am not that impressed.

Ocena przepisana z notatek / innego serwisu, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na RateBeer. Butelka. Dość szczodrze palony, sporo kakao i espresso, balans przesunięty w stronę półwytrawną, słodu tylko tyle co trzeba, goryczka średnio-wysoka, palono-chmielowa, sporo pełni, nisko wysycone, gładkie. Chętnie powtórzę, jak gdzieś zobaczę.
Bardzo dobry fes, czuc mleczna czekolad?, kakao, orzechy. W smaku jest spora gor?czka i fajnie ukryty alkohol, troch? palonosci.

Aroma: Cocoa, dark chocolate, some coffee, very intensive. Appearance: Black body, creamy beige head. Taste: A roasted FES, lots of dark chocolate, tobacco, cocoa, some chocolate, nicely bitter, mediumly sweet, yummy. Palate: Very soft texture, despite the bitterness, low carbonation, medium-high body, semi-dry finish.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, mocha, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, chocolate and mocha; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. This is especially true for its abv. Super sweet chocolate start with a decent roasted finish as well. Perfect appearance and a great aroma and palate. Mighty fine beer from The Kernel again.

Tap at Pułapka, Gdańsk. Pitch black beer with rocky brown head, good retention and lacing. Aroma of high quality coffee, tobacco, cocoa, light vanilla. Taste is medium sweet and bitter, of smooth coffee, bitter chocolate, roasty, with notes of cocoa, licorice and dark fruits. Medium+ body, oily texture, soft to average carbonation. Great FES!

Proefglas van 33cl-fles tijdens HOP goes Black in Gainsbar te Kortrijk. U: Zwart met een bruine schuimkraag. G: Koffie, cacao en een beetje kalisse. S: Zoet met een stevige moutbitterheid. Koffie, cacao, drop en wat vanille. M: Volmondig, licht sticky en medium carbonatie.

Bottle from The Kernel Brewery, Bermonsdey, London (UK). Colour dark brown. Roasted complex aroma of liquorice, light coffee, dark chocolate, notes of dried fruits. Flavour is roasted malts, coffee, licorice, dried fruits, vanilla.

Bottle, well stored. Pitch black body with a big, stable, dense tan head. Strong aroma of dark, roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Flavor is very smooth but heavy roasted at the same time, dark malt, coffee, dark chocolate, liquorice and balanced mild bitterness. Well balanced body and long lasting strong and smooth aftertaste. Pure joy, lots of flavor and no sharp edges really.

30cl van de tap bij Zeezicht, Breda
Alcoholpercentage van 7,2%
Uitgetapt in Zeezicht glas

Uiterlijk: zwart met kleine cremelaag 

Aroma en smaak: koffie, chocolade, goede bitter, gebrande mouten

Conclusie: lekkere volle Engelse stout

Aromat - dużo czarnej kawy, czekolada deserowa.
Smak - dużo kawy i nut palonych, czekolada.
Długi posmak kawowy. Ciut za mało ciała.

Densa, oleosa. En nariz primero chocolate con leche y ciruelas pasas, luego mucho café molido. En boca torrefacta y equilibrada, con un fondo de amargor herbal. Regusto seco y prolongado. Cervezote! Bottled on 22/12/2016. BB 22/12/2018

Color negro, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación mínima. Textura aceitosa. Aroma torrefacto, a café, chocolate, pasas. Sabor dulce en boca, pasas, café, con final de café amargo y duradero. Muy rica.

Bottle. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, hay, raisins and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with some chocolate, caramel, hay, grains and bread. Medium body, average carbonation.

330ml bottle served in a snifter glass. 
A: Pours a oily dark black color forming a medium and creamy beige head with medium retention that forms lots of spotty and molasses lacings in the glass. 
S: Nose is sweet, fruity and biscuity. Strong notes of roasted malts, coffee beans, dark chocolate and earth. Notes of Oreo and dark dry fruits. Grassy hops. Hints of nuts and alcohol. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Strong notes of roasted malts, Oreo, dark chocolate, coffee beans, dried berries, raisins. Becomes dry and bitter but keeps a bit of sweetness. Grassy hops profile. Hints of nuts and alcohol in the end. Medium bitterness as expected. 
M: Medium to full body. Medium to low carbonation. Dark chocolate, coffee and nuts in the aftertaste. 
O: Very good drinkability. Masterpiece.
Kernel wymiata głównie ipami, ale to jest wzór stouta, pity po Partizanie porównawczo bije go o klasę: równowaga, elegancja, balsamiczność.

(keg) black in colour with a frothy beige head. aroma of toasted malts and hazelnut husks, with some notes of sugar icing, fudge and cornflakes. flavour is mostly the same, lots of toasted malts and ash, with a hint of charred oak, some light ethanol and a medium toasted-bitter finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

Bottle 0,33. Pours pitch black with large foamy brown head, long retention. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, alcohol is noticeable. Pleasant smooth taste with notes of coffee, roasted malts, black berries, some bitterness in the aftertaste. Full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft to flat carbonation. Very good.

(on tap)
Aroma:coffee,dark chocolate.
Appearance:almost black color,beige long-lasting head.
Taste:dry,flavour of coffee,dark chocolate,roasted malt,malty roasty finish.
Palate:medium body,low to medium carbonation.
Overall:Nicely done roasty stout.I dig it !

Po przelaniu do szkła tworzy się ładna, beżowa piana, dość trwała. Barwa ciemno brązowa, prawie czarna. Aromat intensywny i przyjemny, sporo czekolady, pralinek, lodów czekoladowych, kawy, marcepanu i wanilii, może nawet suszone owoce... W smaku półsłodki, czekoladowy, kawowy, popiołowy. Tu również czuć coś na kształt ciasta czy lodów czekoladowych, w kontrze do tego tytoniowa goryczka i delikatne muśnięcie alkoholu. W odbiorze pełny, gładki, aksamitny i lepki, ze średnim do niskiego wysyceniem.

Bardzo pijalny, chyba jeden z lepszych FESów jakie degustowałem, mimo jego klasyczności i stonowaniu.
Extremo Espresso Attack. Long, dry & säuerlich sanft. Extra britisch und very Worldclass. Majoran & Co schaun auch mal vorbei. A REAL BIG ONE.....RARE BEER TASTING. BRAUKUNST LIVE 2017.

Keg at Brewdog Aberdeen. Pours black with a nice toffee-tan head. Treacly malt aromas with dark chocolate, alcohol vapour and vanilla fondant. Taste brings on dark treacle toffee, roast coffee and boozy Christmas pudding. A lovely soft mouthfeel with a gentle to moderate carbonation giving the drink an unexpected spritely effervescence. This is creamy, chocolatey smooth, rich with a surprising sparkle. A boozy treat.

0,33 l bottle BB 22.12.18 
chocolate, coffee, roasty, some hints of caramel, black, frothy, brown foam, medium bitterness, medium body, slick feel, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
0,33l bottle. Nose: coffee, roast, dates. Taste: coffee, licorice, light roasty notes. Pleasant sweetness. Very drinkable and well balanced.

Robe brune dense, fine mousse. Nez puissant sur les notes de café froid, de chocolat noir, de café au lait sur un fond de houblon, et de malt torréfié. Bouche à lattaque torréfiée, de la fraîcheur, de la tension, des notes chocolatées, une fine bulle acidulée et une longueur impressionnante. Une bière riche et complexe, de fin de soirée.
@ Basunen 16-12-28: riktig trevlig kaffe ton med fin balans och trevlig eftersmak.

Pours reddish dark brown, almost black, with creamy one finger brown head. Aroma: roasted barley, dark mc alt aroma, with intense note of coffee, dark cocoa chocolate, supported with gentle dark fruits esters. Flavor ispractically the same. Finish is dry. Body is medium, texture soft, carbonation is moderate. Superb "breakfast" Stout.
13/20 dark, smoky and powerful. A bit too carbonated and taste hsa too much smoke / tobacco. Full flavour for 6.5%

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Amazing balance. Great drinkability. Very smooth mouthfeel. A classic stout with a benchmark balance.

Bottle. Pint. Pitch black with medium light brown, thick, frothy head. Moderate head retention and good lacing. Aroma is heavily malty - mainly roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bitter cocoa, licorice, toasty, slightly caramel. Moderate notes of dried fruits - prunes, raisins, very nice override fruit aroma. Lightly earth, ashy, tar and tobacco notes. Taste is almost heavy sweet and moderately bitter, long and stable. Medium to full body, oily and sticky texture, soft carbonation, finish is complex, full of roasted and dried fruits notes with slight espresso-like acidic. . Summary: Complex, balanced and rich foreign stout with almost perfectly palate. Highly drinkable. Very good balance between heavy malty notes and bitterness. ABV is very well hidden. Podsumowanie: Dla prawdziwych mężczyzn ;) Solidna dawka palonych słodów, smolisty, tytoniowy charakter złagodzone odrobiną nut waniliowych. Jednym słowem zrównoważone piwo dwa poziomy do RIS, kwintesencja stylu.

Bottle (7.0%), thanks to my wife. I like counter-signaling labels. Black with a dense tan head thats a fairly soon a coat but never less. Aroma of mocha, cream, prunes, blackcurrants, mint, a hint of smoke. Smooth texture, lowish carbonation. Full bodied, but not heavy. Somewhat earthy and nutty with mocha, berries, spices. Bitterness is on the high side of moderate and builds after a while. Roasty, bitter and slightly salty finish goes on indefinitely. A slower drinker as it went.

sample.bottle. czarne jak smoła, piana niewielka, szybko znika. w aromacie czekolada, słody palone, kakao, alkohol niewyczuwalny, aromaty mega intensywne, w blind teście spodziewał bym się bardzo wysokiego ekstraktu i mega słodyczy, ale w smaku stonowane, głównie słody palone, alkohol wzorowo ułożony, niesamowicie długo utrzymuje się na podniebieniu, kakao, czekolada, cichy zabójca

Good smell of coffee
Beautiful black body with a small tan head.
Taste of coffee 
Mouthfeel is amazingly soft and creamy medium body is.
Very good beer by the kernel team

Bottle
Aroma-chocolate, coffee, caramel, raisin, 
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, lightly sour, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, flat, bitter finish
Overall-perfect

Bottle with thanks to Ben! Pours opaque black, small dark brown head, creamy with nice lacing. Aroma is cocoa, molasses, ashtray, deeply roasted malts. Flavor is medium sweet, medium bitter, huge roast overtones; tobacco, cocoa, espresso grounds. Medium plus body, creamy mouthfeel. Solid beer.
Bottle 33cl @ Cervezorama, Madrid. Great coffee smell, excellent strong flavour and really good palate. Best stout I have ever drunk.
Bottle. Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, kahlua, chocolate liqueur, full, chewy body. Perfect beer, amazingly balanced, with a massive aroma depth.

From 330ml bottle. Pours almost black with tan head that slowly fades. Beautiful chocolate aroma which carries through to the taste. Rich, velvety chocolate, with toasty coffee notes and a bittersweet aftertaste. Very good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

6,9% op het etiket. Zwart bier met bruin schuim. Geur: gebrande mout, brood, koffie, licht vineus. Smaak: stroperig, bitter, koffie, ristretto. Volmondig. Afdronk: bitter, koffie en iets pikant die lang blijft nazinderen. Zeer complex en geprononceerd bier!

Pours inky black with a brown head. Aroma of cocoa, rum essence and peppery, minty hop. Initial sweetness followed by bitterness. Lots of flavours: roast malt, rum and raisin, dark fruits and more hop - a peppermint leafy flavour I associate with Westmalle Dubbel. Smooth, slightly oily, rich and complex - a fantastic beer.

Tap @Royal Navy Volunteer, Bristol.
Medium, dark, creamy head, very dark brown, nearly black colour, hazy, fair lacing. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, bit of vanilla. Lightly sweet with bitter aftertaste. Medium body, bit watery, long finish, flat.
Very nice aroma, but unfortunately it is too watery.
Black with creamy tan head. Chocolate, rum and espresso. Thick, vanilla and dry tobacco finish. Wow!

Coffee, roasted malt, chocolate in nose. Pours black with tan head. Taste is medium sweet with chocolate, coffee, roasty notes, medium to full body. Medium bitterness at the finish. Overall very good, it could easily be mistaken for an Impy.

Barwa ciemnobrunatna, prawie czarna. Piana niska, beżowa, drobnopęcherzykowa, ładnie zdobi szkło. W aromacie dominuje kawa, na drugim planie są ciemne owoce, czekolada i paloność. W smaku, podobnie jak w Imperial Brown Stout, również jest solidna paloność, czuć czekoladę, kawę, delikatną wanilię, majaczy też po pewnym czasie coś w stylu torfu. Bardzo dobry FES.

Poured from the bottle. Pitch black beer. Aromas of roasted malts and rum. Tastes of roasted malts, dried fruit, rum and raisin, just as was promised in the description. A wonderful rich export stout, nice and oily. Love it!

Looks good enough. Smells great, with a strong aroma of roasted malt and burnet caramel. A nice alcoholic hum. Oily on the pallet, with a nice medium to full body. Tastes of sweet malt, bonfire toffee, followed by burnet toast. Lots of nice roasted flavours. Dry on the finish. Dangerously drinkable!

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2016 ,33l pour from bottle into wine glass in Kazakhstan. Dark, totally opaque, weak oily light brown head. Great coffee, roasty nose. Full body, with a thick syrupy finish. Taste has coffee, nuts, cocoa, with a little bit of a burnt finish and a ghost of sweetness. Just awesome.
Bottle. Black with brown head. Aroma and taste is roasted, licorice, dried dark fruits and some coffee. some caramel in the taste also, but far back there. Slightly bitter ending.
Bottle, 330 ml at The Library, Ilsington, London. Pours black with brown head. Roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, licorice, some dried fruit. Medium to full bodied, oily. Great beer.

Bottle 
Pours motor oil black with a nice dark tan head and sparse lacing. Nose is full of char tar roast toffee and a hint of fresh coffee. Big robust nose. Flavors of roast char big char dark fruits lots of anise. Palate is full big and pretty sticky. Long big finish of char and dark fruit undertones. A bit big and harsh but thats good for this style. Solid brew!

Bouteille achetée Au PiBar - De couleur noir avec une bonne mousse fauve qui tient bien et marque bien le verre - Au nez beaucoup de café, malt torréfié, terreuse, légèrement reglisse, cest fin et élégant - En bouche toujours beaucoup de café et de malt torréfié, une grosse amertume terreuse et légèrement herbacé, sauce soja et reglisse - Corps moyen, amertume forte, carbonation correcte, amère et soyeuse, fibal amère et torréfié - Un stout bien brute, bien comme il faut, pas de chichi ca envoie du lourd

BOTTLE 33 CL t 6,9%. Opaque black, espresso head. Medium intensity aroma of sweet chocolate, cacao and strong coffee. Notes of spicy grassy hops. Strong taste of not very sweet chocolate, cold espresso, some malty berry notes too. Peppery hoppy finish with some alcohol spice. Smooth easy drinking body. Not outstanding but a well made honest stout.

Bottle. Very fizzy pour which takes a good while to settle down. Body is nice and mellow- fitting with the abv although the beer still has a boozy hit. 
Very pronounced coffee, with tobacco and rich dark fruit. Nice hints of hops coming through. If it wasnt overcarbonated itd be killer.

Almost pitch black, ligth brown head, not big but dense and persistent. Clean and vivid aroma: roasted malts, milk coffee, caramel. Maybe a hint of dark fruits. Taste follows the aroma, sweet and bitter notes are well balanced, finish is on the bitter side. Only glitch is a slight hint of burnt caramel. Medium to dense body, low carbonation, soft mouthfeel. Good enough

33cl bottle. Deep black colour with a very small and thin tan head. Roasted malts, cocoa, coffee, vanilla and dark ripe fruits in the aroma. Soft carbonation and full body. Taste is bitter with coffee and chocolate notes. Overall, a very good beer, indeed.

On tap, moeder lambic. Black body with huge velvet creamy brown head, excellent lacing. Aroma has light roasty sweetness, caramel, toffee, like dark chocolate mousse. Taste is bitter upfront with smooth caramel and toasty sweetness. Cocoa in the background. Velvet body, like swallowing angel wings. Balance behind the words, smooth like a frothy dark chocoolate. Body is medium, low carbonation, smooth texture.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2016 330ml bottle from Kernel shop. Pours black with brown tick head and thick lacing.

Aroma is wonderfully rich. Dark chocolate, plum, raisin, tobacco, milk, tar and coffee. Taste is equally good, with a nice bitter-sweet balance, thick oily body and a lovely long finish with a touch of salt & pepper and booze at the end.

Impressive stuff.

Tap at the Canal House. Pours black with tan top that would be probably be thicker in the bottled variety. Roasted aroma with coffee tar and chocolate hints but not pungent, subtle notes. A rich raisin date and prune mouthful with underlying licorice and bitter cough mixture tones. Oily and full on the palate. Overall, rich - not sure I would have managed a pint at £6.50 a time.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2016 (33 cl. bottle into wine glass.) Pours rather thick, more than I?d expect of a 7 ABV. Beautiful half finger beige head. The aroma is dense with a wide, full chocolate note hanging peacefully with hints of vanilla. Taste is fully roasted, indeed with some of that dark chocolate and a grainy mocca mouthfeel. I think I have never had such a light but full stout. Great one.

33cl bottle. Black, opaque, with a brown thick creamy head. The yeast stays at the bottom of the bottle. Roasted aroma, cocoa and coffee, tar. Medium sweet with quite a bitter finish. Smooth texture, creamy to oily. Soft carbonation, full bodied. Very good.

0.33 l bottle from De Bierkoning, 7.4% abv, bottled in january 2015. Pitch black with a thin, creamy, stable, brown head. Sweetish-malty, roasty aroma of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, dark ripe fruits, hazelnut and some vanilla. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty taste of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, some licorice and hints of dark ripe fruits, followed by medium long, moderately roasty-bitter finish. Full body, creamy to oily mouthfeel, flat. Good balance, not too much complexity maybe, but great on the palate and rather easily drinkable. Very nice!

Piana tworzy się wysoka, beżowa, ale bardzo szybko opada. Piwo jest refermentowane w butelce, więc pod koniec nalewania robi się już bardzo mętne. Starałem się nalewać klarowne, ale w drodze ze sklepu chyba trochę się zabełtało, no i wyszło tak sobie.
Aromat dość intensywny, sporo gorzkiej czekolady, obecne są też te słynne tytoniowe nuty od angielskich chmieli. Gdzieś tam z tyłu kręci się też lekko kwaskowaty drożdżowy aromat.
W smaku mocno palone - po prostu intensywny smak palonego ziarna. Średnio pełne. Pozostawia lekko popiołowy posmak. 
Piwo jest okej, ale jestem w stanie wymienić co najmniej pięć polskich extra stoutów, które bardziej mi podpasowały.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2017 Magnificent beer jet black good tan head vanilla Italian espresso tar big roasts balances switch a milkshake sweetness  silky oil mouthfeel tastes stronger than its 6.5 great stuff.

Poured from the 0,33 bottle. Wonderfoul brown head, aroma of bitterr cocoa, dark and burnt malts, melanoidines. Pretty strong bitterness balancing the thick (as for a stout or even foreign extra stout) body. Some hints of bitter chocolate and strong burnt malts (even tar) in the aftertaste. Some features of RIS in a beer which has only 6,5 abv. Pretty good beer, could contain less of tary notes, but overall great.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2017 Bottle from Beergium. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with espresso, roasted malts, vanilla, nuts, hops, rum, a bit of chocolate and dark fruits. Bitter finish with espresso, nuts, vanilla, a bit of chocolate and roasted malts. Exquisite foreign stout.
Raisiny nose, great looking head. Coffee dominated taste but pretty bitter too. An excellent stout. Bottle. Bottled August 2015.
330ml bottle. Black with one finger beige head. Big coffee aroma, some lactose aroma. Flavor is a lot coffee, nice flavor. Ends dry. Great stout.

Aktualnie No 1 na świecie w kategorii : Foreign Stout  
Alkohol: 7,1% obj. 
Kolor : Czarny . Nieprzejrzysty. Delikatne rubinowe refleksy u podstawy piany. 
Piana: Ciemno beżowa z lekkimi rubinowymi refleksami. Czapowata, bardzo zwarta i intensywna jak wata cukrowa. Tworzy liczne drobne pęcherzyki. Bardzo długo się utrzymuje. 
Zapach: Aromatyczna kawa z odrobiną mleka. Karmel. Vanillia. Gorzka czekolada. Dymione nuty w tle.
Minimalne torfowe i popiołowe aromaty również wyczuwalne. 
Smak: Dokładnie to samo co w zapachu. Prócz tego jeżyny., lekkie rumowe nuty, kakao, karmel. Wyraźna paloność. Goryczka jest umiarkowana i bardzo stonowana.
Alkohol przyjemnie rozgrzewa, ale nie wychodzi na wierzch. 
Wysycenie: Niskie. 
Podsumowanie:  
Świetny stout. Dokładnie pomiędzy klasycznym stoutem, a RIS-em. Jest bardzo dobrze zbalansowany. Pomimo że jest wytrawny pije się go lekko i przyjemnie. Alkohol mimo wysokiego woltażu praktycznie niewyczuwalny.
Cholernie smaczny!
Bottle 13 months old. 7.4% Dark and fairly viscous, very black with dark brown head. Nose is stewed prunes, tar. Taste is burnt malts, dark stewed fruit, bitter hops. Classic.

Looks fabulous, with frothy coffee lacing on a sleek black body. Big milky coffee aroma with a hint of cherry. Medium body, creamy texture. Taste has espresso, bitter chocolate, vanilla and roasted malt.

Dark brown colour with beige, thick head on top. Lacing sticks to the sides of the glass. Aroma has dark chocolate, roasted malts, cookie malt notes. Taste has sweet dark chocolate, roasted dry malts, some coffee flavours. Full body and medium carbonation.
Nothing need to be said about this beer. Its in the top class league. Super creamy and smooth mouth feel. Coffee and chocolate in taste and flavour. It indeed is one of the best FES style beer ever.

Un ebano impenetrabile è sormontato da una fittissima schiuma nocciola. Le tostature estreme offrono al naso sentori di caffè in grani, cacao frutti rossi e vaniglia. In bocca è una carezza che sfiora la lingua con un tocco amaro di torrefatto e acido di abbrustolito. Finisce amara e lunga con recupero di sensazioni legate alla liquirizia ed al cacao in polvere, il tutto velato da un esile strato di cenere.

0.33l bottle. Pitch black body, thin light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts, caramel, cocoa and some floral hops. Taste of roasted malts, chocolate, cocoa, floral hops, sour cherry and coffee. Awesome.

Bottle thanks to Kapusil! Terrific nutty roasted malts, chocolate and  coffee aroma. Taste follows suit. Black color with little tan head. Heavy roasted malts everywhere maybe some rum too. Very balanced and delicious stout.
UPDATED: MAY 15, 2016 Cant be as descriptive as this sites description. Maybe has a bit strange smell, but still a great stout.

Aroma: plum, dried fruits, dark chocolate, roasty, molasses
Taste: light bitter, dark chocolate, roasty, roasty, fruity
Keg at Hop Inn, Newcastle under Lyme. Pours black brown with a tan head. Some smoke, plenty choc, dark fruit, touch of rum. Good stuff
Tap at Kaapse Brouwers Anniversary 2015. Chococococoffeecuckoo. Backlog from 2015/05/30.

Keg at The Hop Inn, Newcastle-Under-Lyme. A black colour with a thin tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, some tar, slight vanilla and a little hazelnut. Taste of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, a little raisin, some other dark fruits, subtle hazelnut, a hint of vanilla and liquorice. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dry, lingering, chocolate vanilla, roasted bitterness in the finish. A full on roasted stout, a little bit of sweetness that works well. A sipping stout that is nice to drink.

Pitch black, with a nice, velvety, coffee coloured head. Smells like dark chocolate, smoke, roasted malt and coffee. Tastes exacly like I envision an stout: dark chocolate, bitter cocoa, sme coffee, smoky malts. Very well made.

0,33l bottle at home. Bottled 21.01.2015, BB 21.01.2017 7.4% ABV. nice dark almost black color, has a nice stable and mid-sized dark coffee-colored head. looks great. smells very nicely roasted, both earthy and smoke notes. some spices noticeable, also some very nice coffee notes, light notes of bitter chocolate, cacao. After the beer warms up a bit the coffee and chocolate come even more to the foreground. very nice smell, love it. full body, rather light carbonation, rather light mouthfeel (considering the ABV). oh shit, whats happening? there is a lot of .... vanilla and licorice on the taste, two of my least favorite flavours in a beer, especially the vanilla. apart from that some earthy notes, light smoke, spices, only very light coffee and chocolate, also some roast, but overpowered by all the vanilla. finishes with vanilla, some roast and a bit earthy. Overall still a nice beer but not so much my thing. If the taste was just a little closer to the taste I would have loved this ... but oh well.

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate chocolate, espresso, burnt notes, black licorice, and vanilla. Its a dark brown with some orange highlights and a small beige small khaki head that fades to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. The flavor starts with moderate dark chocolate, light caramel, and a hint of molasses. The finish has moderate espresso, burnt notes, and a hint of vanilla. Its a medium bodied with mild carbonation.

Bottle. Dark brown colour with beige head. Aroma is roasted, coffee, cocoa, espresso, caramel, some molasses in background. Taste is roasted, caramel, sweet, some alcohol is present. Dry roasted aftertaste.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2015 Dark roasted stout. Sharp alcohol and really hits the spot. Very strong on the malts. Its thoroughly enjoyable. Complex and Strong. Bit too many malts for me. I prefer something a little crisper

Pitch black, oily. Brick red foam. Aroma molasses, cocoa powder, prune jam. Palate heavy as hell. Sourish coffee, prunes in alcohol. Like good rich espresso with a sip of rum. Taste better than aroma.
This beer was lovely. Some chocolate in the taste. One of the best stouts Ive tried.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Black color with beige head. Aroma is roasted malty, chocolate, coffee, light fruity and light hoppy. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily silky body with soft carbonation.

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 04.06.17 Pours unclear dark brown to deep black liqid, medium frothy brown head, Aroma: roasty, dark chocolate, light citrus, yeasty, red berries, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light to medium sour, roasted, coffee, dark chocolate, cranberries, citrus, lemon peel, yeasty, Palate: medium to full body, average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long bitter roasty aftertaste, Overall: enjoyed, very nice stout.

Butelka 033. Czarne z fajna bezowa piana. Aeomat mega zlozony palone slody kawa czekolad. W smaku dobrze zbalansowane jest duzo palonosci, gorzkiej czekolady, kakao i jest spora goryczka ale wszystko nie za ostre. Takiego FES lubie czyli jest konkret moc ale nie przesadzona w zadnym kierunku. Pycha.

Bottled from Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Pitch black, lasting brown head, beautiful. Powerful nose of roasted malts, coffee, licorice, chocolate, vanilla. Mainly bitter, somewhat sweet flavor, roasted malts, coffee (espresso), licorice. Thick mouthfeel. Everlasting bittersweet finish. Those Kernel guys definitely know what they are doing, truly great stuff!

11/20/2011 2:06:22 PM Bottle from Bierkoning. Dark black body with thin tan head. Nose of licorice, anice and oils. Taste is also oily malts and espresso. Texture is smooth and sticky. Quite enjoyable.

Nieprzejrzyście czarne, z piękną, drobną, beżową pianą, która fantazyjnie zdobi szkło. Aromat to mieszanka, gorzkiej czekolady, kawy i paloności. W smaku piwo jest pełne i gładkie. Słodka czekolada, kawa, popiół i gorzka czekolada na finiszu. Całość tworzy doskonałą kompozycję, coś jak wytrawny czekoladowy deser. Piwo lekko skleja usta, jest bardzo intensywne.
Dark black pour with dark brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, roasted malts and dark fruits. Great beer.
Pretty good style between -Imperial stout and stout . Oily texture. Flavor of rhum, raisin. A presence of herbal bitterness, floral hops. Of course, smoked, coffee and chocolate.

Black colored, strong tan creamy lasting head. Aroma is of chocolate, roasted malt, bit of roasted acidity and some sugar. Taste is medium to strong sweet brown sugar and chocolate with a constant bitter chocolate and strongly roasted background, some licorice. Dry roasted and strong dark chocolate finish and a lasting aftertaste. Medium to full bodied and moderate- carbonation, sticky.
(on tap, Moeder Lambic, Brussels, B)

Bottle from Bacchanalia, Cambridge. Dark, dark brown, vey nearly black. Impenetrable. Carbonation allows a bit of milk chocolate coloured head to swirl on top. Soft aroma of chocolate, vanilla, eggnog, a bit of strong black coffee. Figs. Surprisingly sweet start to the taste is met by a reasonably grainy bitter. Intense. Bitter but balanced finished. The body in not particularly thick for a strong stout but it doesnt need to be. Carbonation is well-judged. A winner.

I love history and I love beer so historical recipes being re-created really draw my attention.

This is the Kernel Export Stout London 1890 recipe 7.1%

I had the 10.1% Imperial Brown Stout London 1856 which was excellent so I am eager to try this bottle I picked up in London.

It pours a deep black with a thick rusty tan head of foam. The aroma is rich savoury chocolate and toasted oats. It may even have hints of marshmallow?

Full bodied with a silky smooth texture, this is hardcore.

The taste is darkly bitter roastiness, oats, dark chocolate, dried fruits, some espresso dark dark dark coffee notes.

Really great but I feel the 1856 was sweeter/less bitter and so I know what Ill be picking up next time I am in the UK.

Kernel Rocks.
Origin: Tap. Vessel: Stange. Supplier: The Famous Royal Navy Volunteer. Deep and rich with smoky aftertaste.

Bottle, bottle date 04.06.15, 7.1% abv, pours black and tan. Chocolate, espresso, roast, dried pineapple, ash, leather, fruitcake, vanilla. Medium sweet and moderate high bitterness, oily to creamy texture, full body, soft carbonation. Lingering espresso and hopbitter finish. Lovely.

Aroma of cocoa, coffee, brown sugar and hints of leather and vanilla. Black with a tan head. Medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter. Full body with a average to soft carbonation. Leaves the mouth quite dry. Overall a very enjoyable drink, rich flavour with a full body combined very nicely.

F: thin brown, gone to thin film with some bubbles.
C: dark, non-transparent.
A: roasted malt, caramel malt, chocolate malt, dark chocolate, of coffee.
T: great roasted/chocolate/dark malt, some earthy tones, dark chocolate, some espresso, fruity tones of dark fruit, cocoa and many others complex tastes, 7,4% ABV version, full body, low carbonation, very good, a must to try beer from that style.

In bottiglia. Colore marrona scuro, schiuma marrone, fine e poco persistente. Aroma intenso di tostato, caffè, leggero bruciato. Al palato corpo rotondo, nota etilica non eccessiva, caffè e tostato intensi e puliti. Semplice e ben fatta.

WYGLĄD: Barwa czarna z rubinowymi refleksami, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, gęsta, długa i wysoka. Ładnie oblepia szkło.
AROMAT: Intensywny. Kakao, praliny, kawa, owoce w czekoladzie, subtelna paloność. W tle zioła.
SMAK: Dominuje paloność przemieszana z ziemistością. Delikatny kawowy posmak - przyjemny. Świetnie ukryty alkohol. Goryczka średnia, zalegająca.
OGÓLNIE: Cudowna pijalność, aksamitne, kremowe - wprost nie do opisania. Trzeba spróbować, żeby się przekonać jak dobrze to piwo smakuje!

Color is heavy black with a bit of brown. Can see the high gravity when pouring. The aroma is very strong and deep; caramel coffee and malt. The taste is smooth, again with caramel. Brilliant beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Three year old bottle. Solid black with a fizzy brown disappearing head. Deep liquorish full smooth black bean caramel roasted coffee smell. Full oily body. Initial taste of caramel and chocolate and moves to a smooth liquorish and finishes with a nice soft coffee roast. Excellent. Sort of reminds me of Lion Stout.

Bottle 0.33 l, Drink Hala, Wrocław, Poland.
Czarne piwo o ciemnobeżowej, puszystej pianie i intensywnym, palonym, kawowo-czekoladowym aromacie. W smaku gęste, kawowe, wytrawne, lekko likierowe z palonym, goryczkowym, początkowo lekko kwaskowym finiszem.

Keg at Smithfield Tavern, Manchester. Black with a tan head that fades down to a ring. Coffee, liquorice and molasses aroma. Hops can be felt lurking too. Taste is much the same. Thick and milkshakey, but drinkability is good. I like how the hops help to cut out the sweetness without stealing the show from the malty side. Good stuff.
330ml bottle at home, source unknown (7.2% abv), coffee, chocolate aroma, opaque very dark brown, no head, coffee, cocoa, liquorice flavour, oily, soft carbonation, dry bitter coffee aftertaste
Alluring aroma in a moonless midnight black pour. Flavour is a brilliantly balanced mix of cocoa, coffee, and licorice.

Bottle at home. Black with beige head. Massive roasted coffee aromas... taste follows suit. Coffee, chocolate, burnt, roasted malts. Thick and oily, slight lingering bitterness. Delicious, and incredibly moreish.

Bottle. Pitch black, beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee. In taste mix of especially dark chocolate and very roasty coffe, really pleasant. Medium bodied, oily, softly carbonated, very smooth. Great stout, one of the best beer from Kernel.

Bottle. Almost black oil, avarage tan foam. Aroma: dark malts, velvety biscuit with chocolate, coffee with brandy. Taste: blend of wine, whiskey and coffee, warming, dried prunes, raisins, roasted barley, bitter chocolate, dry and hoppy aftertaste.

Looks..black, sml light tan head.
Smells..choc, vanilla, roasty malts.
Tastes.. Loads of choc, vanilla, medium burnt grains and a late hop and coffee grind bitterness.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Jabeerwocky, kran. bardzo intensywne w smaku i aromacie, czekoladowo, kawowo, palono, popielniczkowe. w strone RIS troche, z suszonymi sliwkami w nutach, gesta faktura w ustach. niskie wysycenie, oleiste, nieco lepkie, z kiepska piana, jest tez goryczka, wcale nie taka niska jak na stouta. w caloksztalcie: Super.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Black colour, with a brown head, aromas of chocolate, coffee and dried fruits, amazing full body...

Look; black body, persistent beige head.
Aroma; coffee, black chocolate, black malts, sweet wooden oil, caramel notes.
Taste; super black chocolate tart, cocoa, leather, shoe polish, roasted black soft malts.

Good body with soft carbonation.
Finishes malty fruity and lingering. Good brew. Handmade impression.

330ml bottle. 6.7%. Pours black with frothy tan head. Tastes magnificent. Exceptionally well-blended with plenty of blackened malts, chocolate, leather and dried fruits with a hint of CDA. Hits the spot.

black, medium long-lasting beige foam, very nice lacing; roasty, lots of chocolate, coffee, some dried fruits; medium+ bitterness, medium sweetness, lightly sour; medium+ body, oily feel, rather soft carbonation, long roasty and dry finish;
Overall: great taste, very good looking, very good mouthfeel and aroma, very well-made

Sampled @ Tilquin English Beer Festival 2015

Sehr dunkel braune Farbe, mittelgroße bräunliche Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Kaffee, Schokolade, bittere Kaffeebohnen. Geschmack schokoladig, Kaffee, bittere Kaffeebohnen, Vanille..

On tap at St. Andrews Brewing Co.
Kernel - Export Stout - 7.1%
Rich, slightly boozy flavor that is mildly bitter. Full bodied. Higher ABV is more evident in the aroma than in the taste and almost completely hidden in the mouthfeel. Very smooth. Low, but acceptable, carbonation and a weak head. A hint of vegetative aspects in the aroma. Some suggestions of barrel aging in the flavor.

Pours crude black with a large and dense mocha-brown head. Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, raisins and slight dried fruit. Taste is coffee at first followed by a touch of sweetness in the form of raisins and chocolate, leather and slight smokiness are next to descend upon the buds. Full bodied with a rich mouthfeel. Kernel have nailed everything.

Bottle. Black pour with a dark tan head. Aroma is cocoa, light coffee, chocolate roast, and fairly assertive but complimentary pine and hop bitterness. Taste is rounded chocolate with pine and hop bitterness followed by light roast and coffee with some background dark fruit into the finish. Clean, somewhat sharp mouthfeel. Good hop forward stout.
Pours black with a small beige head. Fantastic aroma of coffee, chocolate, rosted malts. Taste of roasted malts, chocolate and coffee, medium bitter finish. Very good stout from Kernel.

Warka zabutelkowana 15.09.2014. 
6,7 % alc.

Piana: Dość niska (1 palec), drobnopęcherzykowa, beżowa. Opadła po ok 3 minutach. Zostawia duży lacing.
Barwa: Czarna. Ciężko określić czy piwo jest klarowne.
Aromat: Świeżo zmielona kawa, czekolada, paloność. Gdzieś w tle wyczuwalne ciemne owoce.
Smak: Espresso. Goryczka i delikatny kwaskowy posmak typowy dla mocnej kawy. Coś niesamowitego jak piwo może być bardzo kawowe. Do tego dochodzi gorzka czekolada.
Wysycenie: średnie
Piwo jest wytrawne. Dawno nie piłem czegoś tak dobrego. Nie chcę stwierdzać że to najlepsze piwo jakie w życiu piłem ale na pewno wskakuje do ścisłej czołówki. Zrobiło na mnie ogromne wrażenie

330ml bottle a couple of times. dark black pour with very dark brown head. aroma is coffee, chocolate, roasted malts and dark fruits. taste is full of espresso, velvelty smooth chocolate, a little alcohol and dates/raisins. excellent.
3.3.2015. Roasted aroma with espresso, sweet chocolate, dark fruits. Oily texture. Plenty of roasted malts, espresso, hints of chocolate and smoke, dry cacao.
Birra dallaspetto ottimale ed un gusto buonissimo al caffè. Forse i 7,2 gradi alcolici sono un po pochi per questa birra. ;)

Drunk from 33cl bottle bottle bought at deliciously different in Belgium. Dark with slightly sharp taste stout beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wanted to taste this one already some time. Good mixture of coffee and hops. Slightly some wood and fruits. The biterness in the end is nice.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is dark fruit, chocolate, coffee, taste is similar, roasted, bitter.
Bottle from the hive. Pitch black, creamy tan head. Espresso and dried fruit nose. Thick and oily. More coffee and dark fruits. Bitter long finish. Great.

Botella de @Vivalabirra, Oviedo 06/03/2015. Bottle On 24/11/14. 
Colo negro. Aroma a café. Sabor torrefacto. Cuerpo medio, carbonatacion moderado.

In short: drip coffee beer.
Aroma: coffee and toffee, simple yet powerful roasted aroma.
Appearance: pitch black with creamy foam.
Taste: middle sweet to light sour.
Palate: lasting light roasted finish.

Bottle states 8.2% abv. Appearance is almost jet black, with a half-finger light brown foamy head which fades away. Aroma- plenty of coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, caramel, hop hints, chocolate biscuit, the vaguest hint of dark fruit. Taste- lots of coffee bitterness, cocoa-rich dark chocolate, hop bitterness, espresso, roast malt, treacle, medium mouthfeel, dry roasty bittersweet finish. Excellent.

Bottle

The Kernel Export Stout London 1890

330ml bottle. Deep brown color, almost black. Small size, brown head, stays as a ring. Deep roasted malts, sweet, slightly ashy, very faint milky and chocolatey notes on aroma. Fantastic mix of roasted malts and dark chocolate in taste. Touches every tastebud in my mouth and picks me up by the ears. Afteraste is everlasting. Alcohol is very well hidden. Absolutely fantastic! More!

Bottled, 330ml from S.H.Jones in Banbury. Black with tan head. Full, heavy and rich Stout, there is a combination of bitterness from the darkly roasted, chocolate malts then rich fruitcake fruitiness along with the smooth vanilla flavour. It has the feel of an old comfortable sofa, easy and comforting. Loved it.

ABV: 6,7% Bottled 15/09/2014 Magnifique Stout assez sec en bouche qui offre un maltage onctueux sur des notes lactées, avec des notes de vanilles, légèrement fumé et boisé. La gorgé fort douce et dense développe des arômes de chocolat amer et laisse le palais rêche et langue grasse avec une amertume légèrement aigre et fleurie à la fois. Au départ, son nez très parfumé:  fortes senteurs dorge très grillé, voire brûlé, de la vanille et de la levure. Cette levure fruitée apporte des saveurs lointaines de framboise voire de mûre. En toute fin, je reste avec ce maltage fort torréfié sur des notes acres mais adoucie par cette sensation lactée. Superbe!

Bottle. Pitch black with a tan head. The aroma consists of roasted malts, chocolate, chocolate, liquorice and dried fruits. Moderate/heavy sweetness, moderate bitterness and a dry, somewhat bitter finish.

Coloración marrón intenso, casi negro. Buena formación de espuma y buena estabilidad. En nariz presenta suaves notas quemadas, café solo e intenso y suaves notas achocolatadas. En segundo plano y de manera muy sutil aparece notas de lúpulo. En boca el protagonismo es para la malta torrefacta que proporciona notas de madera quemada, café solo e intenso y chocolate puro y licoroso. Amargor procedente de la malta torrefacta. Cuerpo denso y baja carbonatación. Retrogusto seco y prolongado de las maltas torrefactas. La sensación en boca deja pensar que su graduación alcohólica es mayor a los 6,7% que realmente presenta. Muy ajustada a estilo (Foreing Extra Stout)

Bottle. 
Black with a brown head leaving lacing. 
Aroma: roasted, coffee beans, creamy, licorice.
Taste contains the same and adds wine gums, salmiak, fruits and maybe berries, dry finish. 
Very nice.
Svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av røstet malt, kaffe og sjokolade. Smak av røstet malt, kaffe og sjokolade.

Lukt: Fin duft av kaffe, bek, lakris, sjokolade og vanilje.
Utseende: Mørk brun, nesten sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende lag brunt skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: God smak av kaffe og lakris med en anelse sjokolade og vanilje.

Bottle shared with ciaranc. Pours oily black with minimal head. Roasted malt, toast, wood, dark chocolate dry finish. Lovely.
Bottle from The Vineyard. Lush brown pour. Dark chocolate, roasted malt flavour. Medium body, fair amount of carbonation. Long complex finish. Nice.

Du pétrole : noir, pas de mousse. Nez grillé : café, malts torréfiés, chocolat, raisins secs, alcool. Attaque amère, très sèche, café, chocolat, cuir, astringente, fumée, grillée. Longueur interminable. Amertume vraiment très puissante. On croit deviner le houblon derrière tout ça, présent mais bien caché. Très bonne stout, pour les amateurs damertume très sèche et de café !

Bottle from the Darlington Cheese & Wine Shop. Pours inky black with a nice tan head. Lovely coffee aroma. The taste is rich with notes of liquorice, coffee and a slightly ashy dryness. Really nicely full bodied. Very good beer.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2014 [6207-20140228] Bottle. Soya fudge chocolate and roasted malt aroma. Black body with a quick tan head. Roasted soya malt grain flavour has a nice burnt woody charcoal aftertaste. Full body. Very tasty. (8/4/8/4/17) 4.1
(c/o HogTownHarry, w/ him, blankboy, Greg Clow, jercraigs, JoeMcPhee)
Overheard: "Whats the appeal of Skye?" "It has an e at the end."

[6498B-20140709] Tap. Roasted rich malt grain aroma. Black body with a medium-lasting creamy tan head. Super roasted charcoal wood and burnt grains flavour. Full body. Good but overpoweringly burnt. (7/3/7-/3/15) 3.5
(@ Hanging Bat, Edinburgh, Scotland)

Bottle at the Kernel Brewery on 25 Aug 2012. Poured near black, with a big, dense beige head. Aroma of coffee, big roast malt, berries and some peppery hop. Dark rum and dates in the flavour, with tar and dark chocolate. Finish was burnt malt, coffee and prunes.

Bottle 33cl from Malting Pot, tasted @ home with Fabien G.
One of the best stouts I ever tried!
330ml bottle shared with jeevan. Pours jet black, thin tan head. Aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, light boozy notes. Taste is more coffee, dark chocolate. Long finish. Lovely.
Very soft and enjoyable mouthfeel. Rich coffee aroma upon opening. Rather foamy for a stout.
Très forte odeur de café. Goût puissant de café et de fumé. Larrière goût de fumé reste. Très Bon stout.
I love this beer. Full bodied with a lovely flavour. Could drink this all day.

Bottle from Bierkonung. 
Pours heavy black with a thick brown head. 
Full bodied yet drinkable with lots of chocolate, dark malts semi dry finish

W aromacie czekolada, kawa, popiół, czyli wszystko to, z czym stout się kojarzy. Jak na ekstrakt wyjątkow gęste, czekoladowe, z wyraźną palonością, sporą goryczką, pozostawiający kawę i popiół na długim przyjemnym finiszu. Lekko alkoholowy. Mały ris. Świetne piwo.
Tap. Deep roasted malts on nose. Chocolate, coffee, vanilla and cocoa. Smooth and dry character. Some smoke, some herbs. Velvety and milky one.

Pours black like my soul with a complete absence of head. Warm fruity body. Coffee finish. Booze covered up well. Nice stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Smelling of bread, dates, coffee and licorice.Appearance: A dark brown colored beer. A high tan head with good lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting sweet dark bread, dark roasted coffee and bitter peel.Palate: Medium low carbonation, a soft and oily texture. A big body with a dry finish.Overall: Very potent, enormous taste on 6.7%Note: Bottle 330 ml at home. Reviewed 2014-11-06.

Keg at BD ShepBush. Black, tan head slowly sinks to skin. Nose of roast barley, dark chocolate, coffee, tobacco. Tastes sweet cinder toffee, milk chocolate, dark fruit, cocoa, hop bitterness, ashy burnt roast. Medium full body, slick texture, softish carb, lasting cocoa and roast astringency. This beer is bloody delicious.

330ml bottle from Kernel on a Saturday morning.
Pour pitch black with a nice tall tan head.
Aroma is coffee, roasted nuts and trace of chocolat.
Taste is a mouthful of joy. Medium sweetness and bitterness.
Full body, creamy and average carbonisation.

Bottle. Thanks EdKing for this one. Dark body, with brown head, some lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla. Taste of dark chocolate, bread. Tasty beer.

bottle @ lautre oeil. pours almost black with a small beige cap, little retention. loads of dark bitter chocolate, dark red fruitiness, tannic, leather, hint of smoke, minerals and coffee. hint of sweetness backed by resinous and tarred-charred hops and malts. moderate to soft carbonation, medium body - oily, bold resinous and dirt and earth-like finish. good stuff..

Really good beer. From bottle and pours opaque black with tan coloured head. Raisin and dried fruit nose. Caramel and rum flavors. Definite recommend.

A deep dark stout with a thin mocha head. In aroma, a sweet discreet chocolate with nougat notes, classic. In mouth, a nice powdery chocolate and coffee grinds, light chalk, smooth powdery mouthfeel, nice. On tap at Hivernale, Feb. 23 2013.

Bottle (Hivernale): Poured a deep black color stout with a medium size foamy head. Aroma of nice floral coffee notes with some dark chocolate is very enticing. Taste is dominated by some very nice floral coffee notes with very little bitter chocolate and almost no astringency which is surprising considering the amount of coffee notes that are discernable. Light smokey notes are also perceptible though dark fruits notes are not really detectable as per brewers notes. Body is about average with good carbonation with no apparent alcohol. I very much enjoyed this beer and definitely makes me want to try some of their other beers.

12 ounce bottle. My favorite style. Really cool simple label. Pours a very dark brown color with a small beige head. A rich nose of smoky chocolates. Really nice flavor of berries, cocoa, vanilla, milky coffee. Lingering metallic bitter roast and hops. Awesome. Somewhat creamy. Tobacco. Now, this I could consume many of. Not massive, but superbly drinkable. Very fruity in the finish. 1890 must have been swinging in London.
@BBF12. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, liquorish and light chocolate. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, liquorish and some dark fruit.

A black beer with a weak and brown head. Aroma is nicely balanced and tastefull, chocolate, roastiness and some coffee, hint of vegetables, simpler is more beautiful. ¡Qué maravilla! Cremosa, deliciosa,..., suave, como un expresso, y notas chocolateadas. Gran cuerpo con poco gas. Genial como postre.

On tap. Appearance: oil slick black. Tiny brown head. Aroma: Kona coffee, rich dark chocolate, spicy, rosemary. Flavour: amazing creamy coffee and dark chocolate mouthfeel, spices, long dark cooking chocolate finish.  Lovely.
330 ml. bottle.  Thanks Kirk!  Pours black with a small tan head.  Aroma of malt, coffee, and chocolate.  Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruits, and some hops.  Excellent !!

Beer #6 at the 2013 Winter Warmer Montreal, on February 23, 2013. Burnt brown, medium head. Malty aroma of coffee, a little raw, notes of smoked. Taste of coffee cream, very dry, slightly hoppy, very bitter. A very good traditional stout!

bottle Rehills Ncl. black with ruby tints, initial aromas and tastes of rich dark chocolate, with background cola and leather but this develops into strong dark roasted malt, with woodsmoke coming through late on. Taste is quite heavy and complex with notes of vanilla, dark chocolate, espresso, dark ripe fruits and lots of roastiness. Finish is smooth with some ripe fruitness, lots of dark chocolate notes, espresso and vanilla. Nice, quite complex and rich stout.
Kaffe, choklad, vanilj, plommon. Rund, krämig med en angenäm bitter, mörkchokladbeska. Välbalanserad. Riktigt bra.

Bottle from De Molen webshop. Pours pitch black. A fat, rich chocolate nose with tones of coffee. Smooth, rich and sweet. Loaded with velvety chocolate, oily texture, raisins, dark berries, plums, slightly vinous and with a small balancing bitterness. Wow! My first Kernel beer ever.

Bottled. Pitch black color with a small brown head. Lovely aroma of roasted malts, coffee, mocha, some earthy hops. Taste is the perfect balance between dark bitter chocolat and sweet biscuity malts. Medium dry, slight sweetness. Wonderful brew. Did I already mention I think the Kernel deserves a brewer of the year 2012 award? Simply outstanding beer.

Appena versata un po di bollicine di troppo, che però spariscono rapidamente insieme alla gran parte della poca schiuma che si era formata.Sentori di liquirizia con un po di caffe che appare più in bocca insieme a malto tostato... decisamente densa e di mio gusto!

Shared bottle.  Poured thick deep blackish with minimal head.  Nose was black patent and choc malts, cacao, pruney fruit, cacao.  Tastes complex, rich and dense on the palate, with flavor notes of dark malt, cacao, vanilla, prune, finishing hops.  This one is solid.

Bottle. Pours a black beer with a very small, beige head on top that quickly settles into a small ring around the edges.. Aroma is of fresh brewed coffee and dark roasted malts.. some burnt caramel and sweaty feet... wait.. those are my own feet.. Flavour is medium sweet with a roasty backbone and touches of black coffee. Oily texture and flat mouthfeel seems to suit this beer very nice. Long, lingering bitter finish completes the package.. great stout!

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham.   Poured a dark mahogany with a bubbly tan head and a little broken lace.  The aroma is earthy, malty and peaty.  The flavour is bitter and malty, very rich and a little fruity, with liqourice and a some spicy notes.  The palate is bitter, but nice and chewy and surprisingly smooth.  If this is based on an 1890 recipe, then I can see why there were alcohol issues in London in those days!  A superb stout indeed and very highly drinkable.

[ASPETTO] 			
nero mogano tendente al marrone scuro contro luce			
[SCHIUMA]			
nocciola, media presenza, compatta , media persistenza			
[OLFATTO]			
non molto intensa ma con un chiaro apporto dei malti torrefatti, con sentori di cioccolato amaro, caffè, un leggero vanigliato ed uno sfuggente sentore affumicato e torba. Qualche profumo di luppolo langue nel sottofondo facendo compania a note alcoliche			
[GUSTO]			
anche in bocca mantiene  evidenti saporri che ricordando cacao amaro, caffè a cui si aggiunge un leggero tocco dolce cioccolatoso. segue un amaro tostato  che si accuisce nel finale quasi sfociando nel bruciacchiato complice una evidente alcolicità che infonde sensazioni liquorose e raschia il fondo della gola.			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio, non eccessivamente spessa ma molto soffice al palato, carbonazione bassa , alcohol evidente.			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
stout corposa, che dietro il termine export nasconde una alcolicità di tutto rispetto e per nulla timida che la sposta quasi verso il mondo imperial (Stout). Profumi un po avari  mentre in bocca fornisce tutti i sani carateri dello stile, ben equilibrati con quel tocco in più dato da una dinamica e per nulla banale alcolicità che entra al punto giusto lasciando un  retrogusto che ricorda una trufa al liquore. buon compromesso fra una facile stout ed una IS che spesso risultano di difficile bevuta. un personale primo approccio con la Kernel decisamente positivo.

Awesome! Aroma full of dark chocolat, espresso, dark malts and hints of smoke and deep dried fruits... milky liquid, but not extremly... brilliant sweet/bitter balance and a well balanced medium long dark finish
